column3:
Ha, good fix.

Is there any specific reason to do it only on first setModel?

setModel appears to be the function used to give the dialog the user settings (as well as some other things). At present setModel only sets the model, nothing else. So, since this is a bug fix, I wanted to limit the scope of the change to avoid unexpected consequences.\n\nI'm not actually familiar enough with the code to know if setModel is ever called more than once though. So it's possible it's

Thanks for the explanation. I think it is safe to remove the precaution.

Background: A model change in QT implies that the widget state is reset
according to the information in the new model.
Based on your input, I've changed the fix to just simply just call the clear() function after setting the model.\n
Can you rebase this into one commit?\n
